participating-org.narrative:
The Pan-African network for peace, democracy and development (REPPAD) is a pan-African human rights and democracy organization officially established on 16 February 2011 by young Nigerian leaders. Recognized by order No. 592/MISPD/AR/DGAPJ/DLP/of 26 August 2011, the main purpose of the REPPAD is to promote Pan-African values and contribute to peace, democracy and development in Africa and Niger in particular.
In line with its Pan-African vision, the REPPADD is fighting for the values of social justice, peace and sustainable development that translate into democratic, economic and social governance, where all "citizens, men, women, young people including vulnerable persons enjoy in an effective, fair and equitable manner their civil, political, social and economic rights.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to life and security
